instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA? This is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad. Each CD3215 in the system needs to be functioning in order for any of them to speak to the charger and negotiate receiving 20v from the charger rather than the default 5v that a USB-C charger puts out before communicating with the system. .

threads.message:
hello, 
please need help for mainboard  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
i have 5V and 0.120mA
We have replaced the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> on this mainboard same problem
On big coil no have short
Thanks for help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
Which <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips have been replaced?
ALl USB-C ports have the same behavior?

Do you get all expected LDOs on <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
i have replace all
yes with all usb-c have same 
please, check picture for value usb-c
i have test this line :
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA</SIGNAL> : i have 1v8
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD</SIGNAL> : i have 1v8
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BM</SIGNAL> : i have 0V, no short on this line and 0.522 in diode mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>1V1_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> should appear only on the powered port.

Check diode mode on the suspicious lines directly on J3300 and JB500.
Compare the readings between all channels.

threads.message:
do you have value in diode mode for this 2 fpc?
I don't have on flexbv, xinzhizao same
I have found this link but not correct motherboard
